mobs.long_desc: A large, rabid rabbit searches for food.
mobs.desc: This mutant is much larger than the average rabbit.  Its paws are enormous, its size and strength explains its speed as it casts about, looking for food.

mobs.long_desc: A mutant butterfly flutters over the rocks.
mobs.desc: It looks like someone has spent all day painting the wings of this mutant butterfly.  The colors are new and very amazing to look at.

mobs.long_desc: A boa constrictor slowly slithers through the rocks looking for prey.
mobs.desc: A twelve foot long snake its scales glimmering in the sun.  Its head had a flash of color that looks like thunder.

mobs.long_desc: A pit viper is here, hidden in the sand.
mobs.desc: The pit viper, a master of hunting and stealth.  This snake is four feet long, and appears to not have a natural predator.  It also has a large splotch of black on the back of its head.

mobs.long_desc: A lost blind dwarf staggers around.
mobs.desc: This blind dwarf wields a sword of a past king.  His clothes could at one time have been very nice but the years of wear on them have made them look very dingy.

mobs.long_desc: A tall shoeless man dressed in a labcoat wanders around here.
mobs.desc: Tolman looks to be middle-aged, and worse for the wear.  His eyes droop, either from sadness or fatigue, as he goes from beaker to beaker, checking on his experiments.  His white labcoat hangs from his drooping shoulders, and his shoeless feet pad noiselessly as he moves about.
A somewhat large breed of butterfly, this one appears to be the size of a large melon.  Strange, colorful designs plaster its wings.  It flits about the room, seemingly careless.

mobs.long_desc: A regular-looking brown rabbit sniffs about.
mobs.desc: This cute little bunny looks like the average household pet.  About 2 feet in length, it sniffs about the ground, looking for food.  Its long, floppy ears bounce as its beady eyes follows its nose.

mobs.long_desc: A haggard, unkempt dwarf staggers about here.
mobs.desc: This medium-sized dwarf has matted black hair and a wild mess of a beard.  He is somewhat thin, and his eyes squint at the light.  His clothing is in fair condition, if somewhat dirty.

objects.ground: A lucky rabbit's foot is covered in dirt on the ground.

extras.text: Quite large for a rabbit's foot, the previous owner must have been rather fearsome to have produced such a magnificient specimen.  The last owner must not have been very lucky, however, having lost such a vital appendage.  Some flecks of blood stick in the matted rabbit's hair around the area from which the leg once protruded.  A thick strand of twine runs through the foot, allowing it to be worn.

objects.ground: A small rabbit skin hardens in the sun.

extras.text: The waterskin is sewn from the sleek fur of a brown rabbit.  When full, it's squishy, like some horrible furry organ.

objects.short: a small hunk of snake meat
objects.ground: A small hunk of snake meat begins to rot here.
A pair of snake boots are here covered in dust.

extras.text: The boots are hastily crafted from strips of viper skin.  It's thoroughly dried-out, and some of the scales are flaking off.

objects.ground: A slimy mushroom is here getting moldy.

extras.text: The mushroom has shrivelled as it dried, its brownish color mixing with grays and greens.  A slimy coat of mold covers it now, encasing its limp spongey shape in a mix of fungal growths.

objects.ground: A single blade of grass peeks out of the dirt.

extras.text: Its a single long blade of grass, rich green and freshly-picked.  A ridge runs the length of the blade, reinforcing it from its tip to its root.

objects.ground: A pointy viper fang rests here.

extras.text: About 2 inches long, and razor-sharp, this fang looks like it could pierce steel.  Or be worn as an earring...

objects.ground: A small candy bunny is lying here.
A small stone lies in the dirt here.

extras.text: Composed of what appears to be marble and granite, it fits nicely into one hand.

objects.ground: A large stone lies in the dirt.

extras.text: This solid stone, while large and heavy, looks like if used properly, could cause some damage to somebody.

objects.ground: A small clothes hamper rests peacefully on the floor.
A little pool of chemicals has formed here.

extras.text: This appears to be a colorful mixture of many different chemicals.  The colors swirl in a hypnotic rhythm, making it difficult to look away.  In fact, a nap sounds good right about now...

objects.ground: A scientific potion rests on the workbench.

extras.text: The colors of this mixture swirl together in an odd sort of rhythm.

objects.ground: A simple-looking key lies in the dust.
A white labcoat lies unused.

extras.text: Made of soft cotton, this coat is stained from various unknown chemicals.  Two buttons on the left side appear freshly sewn on, as if unused.

objects.ground: A wristband, stamped with a city logo, lies here.

extras.text: This wristband is metal, but somehow slightly stretchy, almost elastic.  Its finely grained metal is stamped with the outline of a city; it appears to be Nordus.

objects.ground: A medium-sized rock lies in the dirt.

extras.text: This rock appears to have been broken out of a larger piece of stone.

objects.ground: A sky-blue potion lies unused here.

extras.text: This potion sparkles with the color of the sky.

objects.ground: A sky-blue potion lies unused here.

extras.text: This potion sparkles with the color of the sky.

objects.ground: A sky-blue potion lies unused here.

extras.text: This potion sparkles with the color of the sky.

objects.ground: Some broken glass lies in the sand.

objects.short: a chest made of pure ice
objects.ground: A chest of pure ice sits in one corner.

triggers.name: pool_of_chems_hurts
triggers.commands: set var1 %random.12% eval damage 10 + %var1% odamage %actor% %damage% acid if %damdone% == 0 osend %actor% The chemicals dribble through your fingers back into the pool. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tries to pick up the chemicals, but they dribble through %actor.p% fingers. else osend %actor% OUCH! The chemicals burn as they drip through your fingers. (&2%damdone%&0) oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% yelps as %actor.p% fingers are burned by some chemicals. (&2%damdone%&0) end return 0

triggers.name: Entry_from_plateau_to_chimney
triggers.commands: if %actor.size% == tiny || %actor.size% == small || %actor.size% == medium wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% leaves down. wteleport %actor% 1691 wforce %actor% look wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% enters from above. else wsend %actor% You're too large to go there. halt end if

triggers.name: Chimney_top_burns
triggers.commands: if %self.people[count]% > 0 set damage 1 set vctm %random.char% wdamage %vctm% %damage% fire if %damdone% == 0 wsend %vctm% The burning smoke blows into your eyes, but you are well protected from its damage. wechoaround %vctm% Burning smoke billows around %vctm.name%, deflected by %vctm.p% magic. else wsend %vctm% Burning smoke blows straight into your eyes!  It burns! (&1%damdone%&0) wechoaround %vctm% %vctm.name% cries out in pain as %vctm.n% is burned by the smoke in %vctm.p% eyes! (&1%damdone%&0) end end

triggers.name: Shards_of_glass_hurt
triggers.commands: set var1 %random.10% eval damage 10 + %var1% odamage %actor% %damage% slash if %damdone% == 0 osend %actor% You pick up a few shards, but find nothing interesting and drop them again. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% grabs some shards of glass, but drops them again. else osend %actor% The shards of glass fall through your fingers, leaving large slices in your hands! (&1%damdone%&0) oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% curses as some shards of glass fall through %actor.p% fingers. (&1%damdone%&0) end return 0

triggers.name: Clean_room_echo
triggers.commands: if %self.people[count]% wecho A large arm swings over your head, spraying you with a chemical mix. endif

triggers.name: open_door
triggers.commands: wdoor 1686 north room 1687 wdoor 1686 north description A small, hand-dug, exit is carved into the wall. wait 2 s wecho A haggard dwarf reveals a hand-dug tunnel to the north. wat 1687 wecho A small noise can be heard as a few stones fall away to the south, revealing an exit. wdoor 1687 south room 1686 wdoor 1687 south description A small, hand-dug, exit is carved into the wall. wforce dwarf say Hurry, we don't have much time! wecho A haggard dwarf rushs north. wpurge dwarf wait 10 s wecho The hole in the wall collapses and is no more! wat 1687 wecho The hole in the wall collapses and is no more! wdoor 1686 north purge wdoor 1687 south purge

triggers.name: dwarven_exit_load
triggers.commands: if (%speech% /= yes) say Excellent, come with me then!  I know another way out! wait 2 s emot cautiously moves toward the back of the cell. wait 3 s mecho A haggard dwarf scratches at some rocks in the wall. m_run_room_trig 1685 end if if (%speech% /= no) say Then you are not friend to us! kill %actor.name% end if

triggers.name: haggard_dwarf_greet
triggers.commands: wait 5 emot rushes toward you, yelling in a frenzy! wait 15 emot trips over his own feet and lands flat on his face! wait 20 emot quickly scrambles back to a corner of the cell. wait 15 say If you're here to kill me, then do it already! wait 1 s say If not, then why are you here?  Are you a friend to us dwarves? wait 2 whine

triggers.name: Fireplace_burns
triggers.commands: if %self.people[count]% > 0 eval damage %random.6% + 6 set victim %random.char% if %victim% wdamage %victim% %damage% fire if %damdone% == 0 wsend %victim% The roaring fire flares up, but you are well protected from its blaze. wechoaround %victim% A flare within the fire engulfs %victim.name%, but %actor.n% is well protected against the inferno. else wsend %victim% The roaring fire flares up, burning you! (&1%damdone%&0) wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% cries out in pain as %victim.n% is burned by the fire! (&1%damdone%&0) end end end

triggers.name: Entry_from_chimney_to_plateau
triggers.commands: if %actor.size% == tiny || %actor.size% == small || %actor.size% == medium wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% leaves up. wteleport %actor% 1639 wforce %actor% look wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% enters from below. else wsend %actor% You're too large to go there. halt end if

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: The ravine opens up here, tall slender trees blow in the wind with a gentle swaying.  There is a small sign stuck in the ground here.  A trail leads from here to the east and south.

North.description: The farmlands begin just ahead.

East.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  A higher plateau is visible in the distance.

South.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

West.description: A high wall makes entry impossible.  Beyond the wall, a large building sits in the sun.

extras.text: Beware the pit viper.  Many have tried, few have succeeded. This is your warning! --The dwarves

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: A dry, dusty wind blows through this area.  A small amount of vegetation, probably spilling over from the farmlands to the north, grows sparsely. Various animal tracks lead off in different directions.  The trail continues to the west, east, and south.

North.description: The farmlands begin just ahead.

East.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  A higher plateau is visible in the distance.

South.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

West.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  Just beyond, a large building is visible.

extras.text: Apparently small furry creatures have been here, maybe rabbit or hare. The paw print, however, is much larger than the average pet.

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: Sparse vegetation litters the expanse of rock and sand here.  A cliff forms a side border the east, and the farmlands are off to the north.  Moistureless air swirls about, and the occasional animal track can be spotted.  The trail leads off to the south, and west.

North.description: There appears to be a hole in the fence, allowing exit into Farmer's Row.

East.description: A wall of stone rises up, seemingly into the sky.  Rivulets of dirt pour down from above, here and there.

South.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

West.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  A farmstead is visible in the distance.

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: Dry, dusty air blows dust across the stony ground.  A few blades of grass are scattered about, but otherwise the ground is barren.  A mirage of a blue lake shimmers in and out of view off in the distance.  To the east, a stone cliff looms large.  The trail continues to the north, east, and south.

North.description: The foothills continue in this direction, ending at the south side of Farmer's Row.

East.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  A higher plateau is outlined against the sky.

South.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

West.description: Thick foliage intertwines in this direction, making passage impossible.  A farmhouse is visible in the distance.  A high wooden wall with twining vines makes movement to the west impossible.  Beyond it is a large building.

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: Gusts of wind sweep across the ground, creating mini-sandstorms, and lowering visibility in general.  There is no vegetation within sight. Tracks left by passing animals lead off in various directions.  The trail leads north, east, south, and west.

North.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

East.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  Another plateau is visible in the distance.

South.description: The foothills continue in this direction, coming to an abrupt halt at a mountainside in the distance.

West.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

extras.text: Different sized paw prints and footprints are scattered about, along with a snake trail leading to the east.

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: Small rocks and pebbles litter the ground here.  A few wisps of grass are scattered about, and various animal tracks lead off in different directions.  A rocky plateau looms large to the east.  The trail continues to the north, west, and south.

North.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  Farmer's row is visible beyond the end of the foothills.

East.description: A granite wall makes passage impossible.  The smooth stone is littered with cracks, and various rock outcroppings drip dust from above.

South.description: A high stone wall prevents exit in this direction.  Outcroppings and cracks make it appear almost climbable.

West.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

extras.text: The cliffside is solid rock, with granules of dirt falling occasionally between crevices and peaks.
These tracks are large paw prints, and various scattered dirt... caused by large wings perhaps?

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: Gusts of wind blow sand across the pebbled ground.  To the east, a rocky plateau is outlined on the horizon.  To the west, impassable foliage blocks any entry.  Tracks of small animals lead off in various directions. The trail continues to the north, east, and south.

North.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

East.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  A higher plateau is outlined by the sky.

South.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

West.description: Countless bushes, vines, and trees intertwine here beneath a high wooden wall. A large building looms to beyond them.

Down.description: A variety of animal tracks are scattered about.

extras.text: The tracks range in size, but appear to be mostly giant paw prints, seemingly from rabbits.  A trail left by what appears to be a snake of sorts leads off to the south.

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: Small rocks and pebbles litter the ground here.  A few wisps of grass peek through the mostly stone floor.  The dirt over the stone is slightly marred by animal tracks, leading off in various directions.  A stone wall is directly to the east, and there are exits leading north, south, and west.

North.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  Farmer's row is visible in the distance.

East.description: A stone cliff ascends seemingly into the sky, with rivulets of dirt falling from the plateau above.

South.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

West.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  A large building is visible in the distance.

Down.description: There are quite a few animal tracks here, leading off in various directions.

extras.text: There are various-sized tracks leading off in many directions.  Most appear to be rabbit paws, although of a much larger variety than the average household pet.  There is also what appears to be a snake trail leading off to the south.

rooms.name: The Snakepit
rooms.description: Walls completely enclose this hole in the plateau.  The smooth rock floor is bordered by stone walls, worn down smooth by years of wind and rain.  Those with the gift of flight might exit up, and a thin squeeze through the rocks to the west is the only other exit.

East.description: A sign is scrawled on the wall in sloppy dwarven lettering.

West.description: There is a faint outline of a door in the rock.

extras.text: If you're reading this, you must have survived the boa constrictors.  Beware, this pit is not the only trap out there!  The pit vipers await! -- The dwarves

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: Gusts of wind sweep across the ground, creating mini-sandstorms, and lowering visibility in general.  There is no vegetation within sight. Tracks left by passing animals lead off in various directions.  The trail leads north, east, and south.

North.description: The foothills continue in this direction, ending at farmer's row.

East.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  A higher plateau is visible in the distance.

West.description: A large mass of bushes and vines are intertwined here, covering a high wooden wall.  A large, stately building is just visible past the wall.

extras.text: Various tracks lead off in every direction, although most appear to be large paw prints.  Rabbits come that big?!  A snake trail leads east and south.

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: The trail leads its way through a stony mess on the ground.  Debris appears to have fallen from the plateau above.  The trail is shared with a variety of animal tracks, leading in different directions.  The trail continues to the north, west, and south.

North.description: The foothills continue in this direction, ending at farmer's row in the distance.

East.description: A rather large stone cliff stands tall.  Cracks meandering their way up the wall are filled with dirt and debris from the plateau above.  The wall appears impassable.

South.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

West.description: The foothills continue in this direction.  In the distance, a single large building and a few smaller ones are visible.

Down.description: Many animal tracks are scrawled into the dirt, which is layered on the stony ground.

extras.text: Little dust swirls dot the area, appearing to have been caused by large wings.  Large paw prints are also scattered about.  A snake trail leads south.

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: The trail comes to an end at a wall.  Carved into the wall are hand-hewn steps, hammered out of stone by a dwarven mallet.  The trail heads sharply downwards to the south.

East.description: The painting here depicts a small dwarf, getting mirthlessly strangled to death at the bottom of a pit filled with boa constrictors.  At the top of the pit stands a young boy, laughing.

South.description: The trail slopes downwards at a hazardous angle.

extras.text: Upon closer examination, hammer marks and chips become apparent.  Although crude, each step looks to be enough to support the weight of even the largest barbarian, maybe even a small army.

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: A mass of vegetation blocks passage to the west, and a large rock cliff prohibits passage to the south.  The hardened rock ground has traces of dirt and vegetation, reflecting animal tracks that lead off to the north and east.

North.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

East.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

South.description: A rocky wall prevents access in this direction.  It seems to reach to the sky...

West.description: A thick mass of bushes, weeds, and trees makes exit in this direction impossible.

Down.description: Animal tracks lead off in different directions.  It appears there's something hidden under some dirt...

extras.text: There appears to be something hidden in the dirt here.  Maybe a search would reveal it...
A variety of animal tracks lead off in different directions.  Most prominent is a snake trail, coming from the north and leading off to the east.

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: The trail leading south comes to an abrupt halt against a mountainside. Swirls of wind kick up dust, making visibility bad.  The trail continues to the east up a steep rise, or into the lower foothills to the west and north.

North.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

East.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

South.description: The jagged stone wall blocks entrance in this direction.  While it appears climbable, a large overhang coupled with the wind make it impossible.

West.description: The foothills continue in this direction.

Down.description: A snake trail, barely visible in the dust, leads up the rise to the east. Barely detectable in the midst of the dirt, it appears something could be hidden...

rooms.name: The Rocky Foothills
rooms.description: The trail heads upwards steeply to the north, and slopes sharply downward to the west.  Large rock outcroppings make traversing this difficult.  Animal tracks go off in both directions.

North.description: The path slopes sharply upwards in this direction, winding its way through large rock outcroppings.

East.description: There's a crude painting on this wall.

South.description: This stone wall has paint spatterings, apparently leftovers from a painting nearby.

West.description: The path slopes gently downwards in this direction.

extras.text: Various paw prints and dust swirls are scattered about, but most noticeable is a snake trail, coming from the west, heading north.
A large picture, painted onto this wall, shows a man standing next to what appears to be a young boy, pouring a liquid from one beaker to another. A large rabbit sits next to the young boy.

rooms.name: In The Hillside
rooms.description: The trail comes to an end, in a cul-de-sac of hillsides.  The trail leads back to the north, and a set of hand-hewn steps leads upwards.  Various animal tracks lead off in both directions.

extras.text: This is your second warning, the pit viper is a vicious predator, and has been know to kill young dwarfs.

rooms.name: In The Hillside
rooms.description: Steep, sloping hillsides border the trail here to the east and west.  The ground consists of wind-smoothed stones, outlined by dirt and rocks.  A dry wind blows dust through this narrow ravine.  The trail leads north and south.

rooms.name: In The Hillside
rooms.description: The trail is naturally formed here by steep sloping hillsides to the north and east.  The ground is smooth rock, worn down by centuries of wind and sand. A dry wind blows dust through this narrow crevice.  The trail leaves to the south and the west.

rooms.name: In The Hillside
rooms.description: The path leads its way through a variety of rocks and sand.  Small bits of plant and other vegetation are scattered about.  The hillside is too steep to the north and the south to trek over.  The trail leads east and west.

rooms.name: Sandy Plateau
rooms.description: This vantage point offers a beautiful view of the entire sandy plateau.  A trail leading into the mountainside leads off to the east.  Sand patches in the rocky ground are marred by a variety of animal tracks.

North.description: Farmer's row lies sprawled out in this direction.

East.description: A trail heads off in this direction, bordered by two very steep mountainsides.

South.description: The plateau continues in this direction.  A mountainside is visible in the distance.

West.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

rooms.name: Sandy Plateau
rooms.description: The ground here consists primarily of a few very large gray rocks.  They are worn smooth from centuries of winds driving sand across them.  A wall of rock makes up the eastern border, and the trail leads north, west, or south.

North.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

East.description: Sloped slightly away from the ground, this wall rises to the next plateau. Within the crevices in the stone lies a dried snake skin.

South.description: The plateau continues in this direction.  A steep mountainside is visible in the distance.

West.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

rooms.name: Sandy Plateau
rooms.description: In this corner of the plateau, winds have created large drifts of sand and rock.  Animal tracks abound, leading outwards to the north and west.  The high walls to the south and east disclose the existence of more mountain.  The trail heads to the north and west.

North.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

East.description: A steeply-sloped rocky wall leads up to the next plateau.

South.description: There is a painting on the wall here.

West.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

Down.description: Tracks from different animals are scattered everywhere in the deep sand drift: rabbit, butterfly, snake...

extras.text: Rabbit paws, butterfly wings... but a distinct snake trail leads off to the north.
A picture is crudely painted on the wall here, of a young boy surrounded by what appear to be two-headed children.  A sorcerer stands just outside the circle, wand in hand, scowling.

rooms.name: Sandy Plateau
rooms.description: The ground here is primarily a few very large gray rocks that have been worn smooth over centuries.  There is sand scattered along the ground, continuing the erosion process.  A plateau is outlined on the horizon to the east.  The trail leads north, west, and east.

North.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

East.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

South.description: There is a painting on the wall.

West.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

extras.text: A crude picture is painted on the wall here, showing a man, lying on the ground, with blood pouring from his body.  A young boy stands nearby, tears running down his face.  In the background is a sorcerer, grinning evilly.

rooms.name: Sandy Plateau
rooms.description: Winds have blown the smooth gray rocks clean, making the floor unforgiving. Occasionally, grains of sand and dirt blow in, but the ground is immediately swept clean by the dry, husky air.  The trail exits in all directions.

North.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

East.description: The plateau continues in this direction.  A mountainside is visible in the distance.

South.description: The plateau continues in this direction.  A mountainside is visible in the distance.

West.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

Down.description: There appears to be something hidden in the sand here.

rooms.name: Near the Pit
rooms.description: Large, grey rocks cover the sandy ground.  Deep enough to make footing treacherous, it seems to fall off to the north a little, where a dangerous pit looms.  Animal tracks lead off to the south and west, and the trail continues to the south and east.  Heading north would lead directly into the pit; probably not a good idea.

North.description: Although the ground is not visible, the plateau continues in this direction.

East.description: The plateau continues in this direction.  A higher plateau is visible in the distance.

South.description: The plateau continues in this direction.  A mountainside is visible in the distance.

West.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

Down.description: Paw prints, dwarven boots, all visible in the wind-blown sand.  A snake trail leads east and west, and some interesting scrape marks appear to lead north.

extras.text: A variety of animal prints lead off in different directions, including some interesting scrape marks heading north.

rooms.name: Sandy Plateau
rooms.description: The ground here is primarily a few very large gray rocks that look like they have been worn down for centuries.  They are very smooth, and have some sand strewn about on top of them.  Another plateau is outlined on the horizon to the east.  The trail leads north and east, and heads down.

North.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

East.description: The plateau continues in this direction.  A higher plateau is visible in the distance.

West.description: The rocky foothills are visible below.  A large building is visible beyond, and to the northwest, a cluster of smaller ones.

rooms.name: Sandy Plateau
rooms.description: A few very large gray rocks make up the ground here.  They have been worn smooth over time, and have some sand strewn about on top of them.  Bits of foliage can be seen peeking through the sand.  The trail leads north, south, and east.

North.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

East.description: The plateau continues in this direction.  A higher plateau is visible in the distance.

South.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

West.description: The rocky foothills are visible, with a cluster of buildings just beyond.

Down.description: Animal tracks leave sand strewn everywhere, barely hiding something just under the surface...

extras.text: A variety of tracks litter the ground, making tracking impossible.

rooms.name: Sandy Plateau
rooms.description: Sand blows across the ground, driven by a wind that seems to change direction every ten seconds.  Gray rock forms a hardened ground, but the sand makes travel slow.  A higher plateau looms to the east, and a rock wall lies south.  The trail leads west, south, and east.

East.description: The plateau continues in this direction.

South.description: The plateau continues in this direction.  A mountainside is visible further along.

Down.description: A variety of animal prints lead off in different directions.

extras.text: It appears some animals dug their claws in, in an attempt to keep themselves from heading north.  The long scrape marks seem to show they failed.
These trails lead off in various directions, including some paw prints and a snake trail.

rooms.name: Over the Snakepit
rooms.description: This is a huge, wide-open HOLE!  A small ledge lies to the south, and hissing can be heard from below.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The uppermost plateau, this section seems to be entirely rock. There are numerous marks all around the edges of the rocks as though something has used it as a pathway for sometime. The trail leads to the east and south from here.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

Down.description: A path heads down into the hillside via some narrow, hand-made steps.

extras.text: What appears to be a snake trail leads to both the east and the south.

rooms.name: The Edge Of The Plateau
rooms.description: The edge of the plateau gives way to a beautiful spread of the lower plateaus.  The ground is solid rock, worn smooth over centuries.  Vegetation is sparse.  The trail leads to the north, east, and south.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The lower plateaus are spread out below, with various critters dotting the scenery.  Just beyond the lowest foothills is a dairy farm.

rooms.name: The Edge Of The Plateau
rooms.description: The ground slopes steeply downwards to the west, making passage impossible. A dry wind blows dust across the smooth stone ground.  Bits of vegetation are scattered in nooks and crannies between the rock.  The trail leads south, east, and north.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The lower plateaus are spread out below, with various critters dotting the scenery.  Just beyond the lowest foothills is a dairy farm.

rooms.name: The Edge Of The Plateau
rooms.description: The trail is slightly difficult, bordered to the west by a steep drop-off, and to the south by a stone wall.  The smooth stone ground is littered with vegetation.  Animal tracks are barely visible in the dirt, leading off to the east and north.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: There is a picture painted on the wall here.

West.description: The lower plateaus spread out below, their critters scattered about.  Just beyond the lowest foothills, a dairy farm is visible.

extras.text: This picture shows a young boy, neck-deep in mud or dirty water.  A Bile Rot appears in the foreground, on a dirt road.  The Bile Rot appears not to have noticed the young boy.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The uppermost plateau, the view is astounding here.  Off to the west lie the two lower plateaus, where creatures abound.  The farmlands to the north reflect the fantastic miracle of tended nature.  The ground is composed of solid rock, broken up by small scatterings of dirt and vegetation.  Animal tracks mark the trail, leading to the east, south, and west.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The ground here is barren rock.  Centuries of wind and rain have worn the ground smooth.  Grooves in the rock indicate a heavy volume of animal traffic.  A dry wind blows dust across the plateau.  The trail exits in the four cardinal directions.

Down.description: There are some well-worn grooves here, leading off in different directions.

extras.text: There are well-worn grooves here, along with partial paw prints and boot prints.  Something or someone must have been walking this trail for years, to wear into the rock like that.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The view from here is astounding.  To the west lie the lower plateaus. To the north, the farmlands glisten in their natural glory.  The ground is mainly stone, smoothed by years of wind and rain.  The trail exits north, west, east, and south.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The ground on this uppermost plateau is solid rock.  There are markings around the edges of some of the rocks, indicating something or many somethings have been using this trail for centuries.  A dry wind blows across the plateau, bringing with it sand and dust.  The trail leads off to the north, east, and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: There is a picture painted on the wall here.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

extras.text: The picture shows a boy walking through the streets of Mielikki.  He's covered in dirt, and his clothes hang loosely off him.  Of all the people looking at each other, noone is looking at him.

rooms.name: The Edge of the Plateau
rooms.description: This vantage point gives a wonderful view of the farmlands, spread out to the north.  Little black bits litter the otherwise barren rock ground here. A dry wind blows clouds of dust across the rock, creating low visibility. The trail leads to the west, east, and south.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: Barren rock lines the ground here.  Black bits are scattered about. Markings along the edges of the rocks indicate heavy animal traffic.  The dry air blowing through brings dust, damping visibility.  The trail leads off in the four cardinal directions.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

Down.description: There are a variety of paw prints, dwarven footprints, and boot prints leading off in various directions.  There's also what appears to be a snake trail, heading to the east and south.

extras.text: There are a variety of paw prints, dwarven footprints, and boot prints leading off in various directions.  There's also what appears to be a snake trail, heading to the east and south.
Upon closer inspection, the bits appear to be soot.  A good amount of the soot is on the south side of the room, dissipating towards the east, west, and north.

rooms.name: The Rock Pile
rooms.description: The trail cuts around a large pile of rock here.  Black smoke is billowing out of the pile, leaving soot everywhere.  A variety of animal tracks lead off in different directions, taking some of the soot with them.  The dry wind blowing across the plateau, combined with the smoke, makes for low visibility. The trail heads off to the north, east, south, and west.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: Smooth rock makes up the ground here.  There's dirt in some of the gaps, creating just enough nutrition for some small fungii to take root.  There's also some small black bits scattered around.  Dry winds blow dust across the plateau, making travel difficult.  A wall of stone makes passage to the south impossible.  The trail leads to the east, north, and west.

South.description: A painting is crudely painted on the wall here.

extras.text: The painting shows a young man, standing on the top plateau here, looking out over the dairy farm.  A team of dwarves, behind him, appear to be working on the side of the mountain.

rooms.name: The Edge of the Plateau
rooms.description: The downward-sloping hillside to the north gives way to a beautiful view of the farmlands to the north.  The ground here is solid rock, worn smooth from centuries of erosion.  The ground is completely barren of vegetation. The trail leads to the west, east, and south.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: Swirls of wind kick dust into the air, limiting visibility.  The hard ground is completely rock, barren of any vegetation.  Black bits are scattered about, and the trail leads to the north, west, east, and south.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: On this uppermost plateau, the ground is solid rock.  Markings at various places on the rock indicate a high level of animal traffic.  A dried snake skin lies alongside the trail.  A dry wind blows dust into the air, limiting visibility.  The trail leads north, south, east, and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

extras.text: This skin is about four feet long, with a nasty-looking black splotch near where the head would've been.  It appears freshly cast off.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The ground here consists of stone, smoothed over the years by the winds blowing sand and rain across it.  Dirt scattered along the ground shows animal tracks, leading off in various directions.  The ground slopes downward to the south.  The trail leads north, south, east, and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: Although the ground is not visible, the peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Above The Viper Pit
rooms.description: This is a gaping HOLE!  The ledge is just out of reach to the north, and the other walls are slick, smooth stone.  A loud hissing sound comes from below.

rooms.name: The Edge of the Plateau
rooms.description: Views of the surrounding areas are breathtaking from this plateau.  The barren stone ground is swept clean by dry winds.  Vegetation is scarce at best.  A dairy farm is visible to the east, at the bottom of the hill.  The trail leads east, south, and west.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: Smooth gray rocks compose the ground here.  The ground is smooth, worn by years of driving winds and rain.  The air is thin, making breathing a chore.  Dirt on the ground is marred by animal tracks, leading off in various directions.  There are exits to the north, south, east, and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

extras.text: Various tracks lead off in different directions, and a snake trail leads off to the south.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The thin air here makes breathing difficult.  The ground is composed of smooth, gray rocks, lined with dirt.  Tiny bits of vegetation are scattered about, amongst animal tracks leading off in all directions.  Visibility is limited in all directions.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: A smooth stone wall blocks passage to the south.  The ground is mostly dirt, but here and there gray rock is visible.  The air is crisp, but thin. Winds kick up dust, limiting the view in all directions.  The trail leads north, east, and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: A picture is painted on the wall here.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

extras.text: This appears to be a laboratory of sorts:  machinery everywhere, beakers boiling... A regular-sized rabbit stands to the left of a young man, and a large, mutant rabbit stands to the right of the young man.

rooms.name: The Edge of the Plateau
rooms.description: The hillside slopes steeply away from here to the north.  The ground on this uppermost plateau consists mainly of gray rock, worn smooth by years of erosion.  There's just enough dirt in the crevices to give life to some fungii.  The downward-sloping hillside to the north appears too steep to climb down, but the plateau continues to the south, east, and west.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: Crisp, thin air makes breathing difficult.  The ground on this uppermost plateau is primarily gray rock.  The rock has been worn smooth by years of wind-driven dirt and rain.  Distinct animal tracks litter the area, and the plateau continues to the north, south, east, and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The flat, solid ground is covered in dirt and sparse vegetation.  Animal tracks are apparent, but lead off in so many directions its impossible to tell which animal went where.  The plateau continues north, south, east, and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: Smooth, gray rocks line the ground here, covered in a thin layer of dirt. Animal tracks are scattered about, but tracing them appears impossible. The plateau continues to the north, east, and west, and a dark rock wall blocks passage to the south.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

East.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The plateau comes to a head here, sharply-sloping hillsides leading down to the east and the north.  While not traversable, they offer lovely views of the farmlands, and further east, Mielikki.  The ground consists of smooth gray rock, which is covered in dirt, marred by animal tracks. The plateau continues to the south and west.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The plateau consists mainly of gray rock, worn smooth by centuries of erosion.  Dirt is scattered about, with visible tracks from animals or otherwise leading off in various directions.  A steep stone wall blocks passage to the east.  The plateau continues to the north, south, and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: Wind-driven dust keeps visibility low here.  The crisp, thin air makes breathing difficult.  Gray rocks make up most of the ground, the remainder covered in dirt and vegetation.  Animal tracks are scattered about, too numerous to figure which animal went where.  A stone wall towers to the east, making passage impossible.  The plateau continues to the north, south, and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

rooms.name: Rocky Peaks
rooms.description: The plateau comes to a head here, with stone walls blocking passage to the south and east.  Smooth, gray rocks are visible here and there, peeking out from the dirt covering the ground.  Scattered tracks are scrawled into the ground, exiting in various directions.  The plateau continues to the north and west.

North.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

South.description: A faint outline of a door is visible in the stone wall.

West.description: The peaks continue in this direction.

extras.text: A variety of boot and paw prints lead off to the north and west.  A snake trail is also apparent, leading north, west, and somehow, straight into the rock wall to the south.

rooms.name: Inside the Rock Outline
rooms.description: A series of large, jagged rocks form a natural tunnel here.  The trail winds its way to the south, through a collection of boulders and rock debris. Patches of moss grow out of what little dirt lies on the floor.  A dank smell penetrates the darkness.

North.description: A door is cut into the stone wall.

South.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

rooms.name: The Natural Tunnel
rooms.description: Rock debris outlines the trail, as if it has been recently swept aside. Large, moss-covered boulders make the trail treacherous.  Patches of fungus line the ground, growing out of the scant amount of dirt left on the rock. A dank smell envelopes the area, thickening the air.  The trail swerves violently to the east.

North.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

East.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

rooms.name: The Natural Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel opens up a little here.  While mostly smooth, the walls still are littered with a few outcroppings of rock, which make traversing the trail difficult.  Mossy patches clutter the ground, and a thick dampness makes the air nearly unbreathable.

East.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

West.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

rooms.name: The Natural Tunnel
rooms.description: The natural tunnel continues, rocky crags forming a natural roof over the stony ground.  Patches of moss are scattered about, making the trail precarious at best.  A large outcropping to the east causes the trail to bend towards the north.

North.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

West.description: The tunnel bends and continues in this direction.

rooms.name: The Break in the Tunnel
rooms.description: The roof of the tunnel opens up here, forming a natural sunroof in the stone.  The break in the rock allows the access of natural elements, clearing the air of its dank smell.  The visible rocky peaks, which seemed so distant from the plateau, appear almost touchable here.  The floor is completely blanketed with moss, making the ground slippery.  The trail continues north and south.

North.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

South.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

rooms.name: The Natural Tunnel
rooms.description: Rocky crags form the walls here, stretching upwards into the ceiling. Large rock formations protrude from the walls, fashioning precarious angles and shaping a natural roof.  Mossy patches fester along the floor, making the trail dangerously slippery.  A faint hissing randomly displaces the silence.  The trail continues north and south.

North.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

South.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

rooms.name: The Natural Tunnel
rooms.description: A combination of large, moss-covered boulders and rocky debris make the trail treacherous.  Partial tracks give some definition of the trail; the remainder have been swept clean.  Stone walls rise straight up into the ceiling.  A dank, mossy smell permeates the room.  The trail continues north and south.

North.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

South.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

rooms.name: The Natural Tunnel
rooms.description: Large rock outcroppings angle across each other, forming a natural ceiling. Granite walls rise straight up into the ceiling.  Boulders and various rock debris form a hazardous trail, leading north and south.  A dank, mossy smell permeates the tunnel.  Faint hissing sounds echo throughout the chamber, seemingly louder to the north.

North.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

South.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

rooms.name: The End of the Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel comes to an abrupt end here.  Piles of collapsed rock wall lie all around, blocking passage to everywhere except back south.  A huge, sandy pit takes up the entire center of the room.  The thick, dank smell present in the rest of the tunnel is not detectable here.  Small lichens line the piles of rock on either side, and the deep sand absorbs pretty much everything.

South.description: The tunnel continues in this direction.

Down.description: A trapdoor is faintly outlined under the sand.

rooms.name: A Dark Tunnel
rooms.description: The dank smell of moss fills the room.  It seems to be coming from the walls; even the air itself seems thick with spores.  The crude stone walls emanate moisture as rivulets of water run down into the darkness below.  A faint glow fills the room, from an unknown light source.  Makeshift steps are cut into the wall, leading back up into the viper pit, or downwards into the darkness.

Up.description: A trapdoor is here, with a picture of a mean-looking snake on it.

rooms.name: A Dark Tunnel
rooms.description: This cramped space seems to have been dug straight into the mountain. Crude steps lead the way, both upwards and downwards.  The dank smell of moss fills the room, emanating from the walls and floor.  A glow pours into the room from below.

rooms.name: Torch-Lit Entry
rooms.description: Torches lying against the walls create a glow that lights the entire cavern. Crude steps, cut into the stone, lead upwards on the south wall.  The mossy smell, so prevalent in these tunnels, is not present here.  The ground is mainly sand, dimpled by water drops falling into the cavern from the tunnel opening above.  A doorless entryway leads off to the west.

rooms.name: Dank Tunnel
rooms.description: Hammer marks are everywhere:  the floor, the ceiling, the walls.  The tunnel appears to have been cut directly into the rock, probably by dwarven hand. Patches of moss line the ground, making the walkway hazardous.  A musty, wet odor permeates the area.  A glow penetrates the room from the east, and the tunnel continues to the west.

rooms.name: The Stone Door
rooms.description: The tunnel comes to an end here.  Torches on the wall keep the room well-lit.  The most prevalent feature of this room is the stone door which lies embedded in the south wall.  The other walls, also made of stone, are marred by hammer marks, but seem otherwise ordinary.  The tunnel continues to the east.

South.description: Consisting of pure granite, this door looks impenetrable.

rooms.name: Crude Hallway
rooms.description: Just inside the stone door, this hallway stretches off to the south.  Cut directly into the rock, the walls and floor are pitted with hammer marks. A dim glow is visible to the south, and a large stone door dominates the north wall.

North.description: A large door made of granite is set in a doorway.

rooms.name: Stone Table
rooms.description: The cavernous room appears to have been cut straight into the mountainside. Dings and scrapes dimple the walls.  A unique sconce illuminates the room with a soft glow, lighting a large stone table which sits dead-center.  Four stools, also stone, surround the table, laying a watchful eye on their stoic roommate.  Doorways lead off in various directions.

extras.text: Made of solid granite, it appears the table has grown out of the floor.  Small markings along the surface indicate it was carved by hammer.
Shaped like a sorcerer's hat, the sconce appears to have been cut directly into the wall.

rooms.name: Pantry
rooms.description: This room is kept brightly lit by torches adorning every wall.  Stone shelves line three of the walls, apparently cut out while fashioning the room.  A variety of food items occupy the shelves, keeping whomever lives here well-fed.  A small sign is carved into the east wall, just under one of the shelves.  An arched stone doorway leads west.

extras.text: Approximately six inches square, it reads "Home is where the food is."

rooms.name: A Bedroom
rooms.description: This cozy room is kept lit by a soft glow, coming from a sconce on the south wall.  A large bed sits majestically in the center of the room; a comfortable resting place for the weary.  A small nightstand sits next to the bed, unoccupied.  A crude door blocks entrance to the west, and an arched stone doorway provides exit to the north.

West.description: A crude stone door blocks entrance in this direction.

extras.text: The bedframe is stone, on which a comfortable-looking mattress resides. A soft down comforter covers the mattress.
Made of wood, this nightstand simply four legs and a tabletop.
Carved into the wall, the sconce is shaped like a wizard's wand, with the light it gives off coming from the lightning bolts streaking from the tip.

rooms.name: A Living Space
rooms.description: Hand-carved stone define the walls, floor and ceiling in this massive cavern.  A comfortable-looking couch sits against one wall, and a coffee table finishes the decor.  A large painting adorns the west wall.  An empty torch holder is nailed to the south wall, and an interesting sconce on the north wall emits a soft glow.  The only obvious exit leads east.

West.description: A large painting is here.  Scrape marks around the painting indicate it gets moved often.

extras.text: In the painting, a small army of dwarves are holding a variety of tools. A young-looking man is standing near them, arms folded.  There are scrape marks around the painting, as if it gets moved often.
Shaped like a rabbit's head, the glow comes from the eyes and gaping mouth.

rooms.name: Closet
rooms.description: Stone walls and ceiling form a perfect space for storing clothing.  Hooks jut out from the wall, apparently cut as the wall was being created.  Empty clothes hangers drape the hooks.  A small clothes hamper sits in the corner. The closet is otherwise bare.

East.description: A crude wooden door seals the way shut.

rooms.name: The Laboratory Entrance
rooms.description: This is the entrance to a laboratory of sorts.  Tightly-sealed doors block entrance to the south.  A large engraving titled "Tolman's Laboratory" is visible over the doors.  A small sign is present on the west wall.  The cavern exits to the south, or back east through a flimsy-looking door.

East.description: A flimsy piece of wood blocks entrance in this direction, probably the back of a piece of artwork as is common in these parts.

South.description: These glass doors are sealed in a resilient substance.  They appear to open by sliding into the walls east and west.

extras.text: Stuck on the wall, near the door to the south, the sign reads "Please remove any footwear, and don a labcoat, before entering"

rooms.name: The Clean Room
rooms.description: The walls, ceiling, and floor are pristine white.  A mechanical arm, operated by some hidden machinery, swings back and forth overhead.  There isn't a speck of dirt to be seen anywhere.  A drain lies in the center of the room, all floors sloped slightly inwards towards that drain.  Sealed glass doors bar exit to the north, and another set of sealed glass doors block entrance to the west.

North.description: These glass doors are sealed tightly together, opening only by sliding into slots in the east and west walls.

West.description: These glass doors are sealed tightly together, opening outwards from the clean room.

rooms.name: Main Laboratory (SE)
rooms.description: A large mass of tubing and machinery take up most of the room.  The south wall is riddled with tubing, all running overhead via suspension braces and supports.  Droplets of chemicals litter the floor, from leaks in the tubing above.  The laboratory continues to the west and north.

East.description: The doors here, sealed tightly while closed, open inwards, providing exit to the clean room.

rooms.name: Main Laboratory (NE)
rooms.description: A large mass of machinery and tubing take up most of the room here, making the space cramped and uninviting.  Countertops are stacked with various unlabeled vials, which glow in different shades of neons.  The tubing above gurgles as unknown liquids tumble through it.  Animal mewlings can be heard occasionally over the sound of the mechanics.  The flickering torchlight shows the laboratory continuing to the west and south.

rooms.name: Main Laboratory (NW)
rooms.description: The laboratory here is slightly different, as only a few lengths of tubing make their way through the room.  A grinding sound is deafening, coming from the mass of machinery to the south and east.  A fireplace crackles merrily to the west, keeping the room warm and well-lit.  The laboratory continues to the east and south.

rooms.name: Main Laboratory (SW)
rooms.description: A large collection of machinery and tubing take up most of the room here. Beakers flare, resting in neat little holders set up over torches.  Chemicals drip from leaks in the tubing, spattering as they hit the floor.  Greasy countertops shine in the flickering torchlight.  Animal sounds can be heard on occasion over the sound of the mechanics.  The laboratory continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: Staging Area
rooms.description: This room appears to be a holding area of sorts.  Torches, fixed to the wall, illuminate a mess of frayed ropes, broken chains, and leftover food scattered all over the floor.  Barred doors, made of stone, border this room on three sides, making the only obvious exit south.

North.description: A barred stone door blocks the way.

East.description: A barred stone door blocks the way.

West.description: A barred stone door blocks the way.

rooms.name: Holding Cell
rooms.description: The damp air makes this already tiny room seem even smaller.  Stone walls form a steadfast border on three sides of this cell, making escape nearly impossible.  A couple of broken chain links indicate some feisty previous occupants.  Bits of food and excrement blend into the layer of dirt covering the floor.  A barred door, made of stone, blocks the only obvious exit west.

West.description: A barred stone door blocks the way.

rooms.name: Holding Cell
rooms.description: This dank, cramped cell is just small enough to make any regular-sized human uncomfortable.  Stone walls encompass the room, making escape nearly impossible.  Food bits mingle with the thick layer of dirt covering the floor.  A barred door, made of stone, blocks exit to the south.

South.description: A barred stone door blocks exit this way.

rooms.name: Escape Tunnel
rooms.description: This cramped crawlspace is just big enough to slither through.  Appearing to have been dug into the stone with just a small utensil, the dark tunnel heads south back into the holding cell, or north to freedom.  Layers of dirt covering the floor appear to be undisturbed, save a few small footprints.

rooms.name: Holding Cell
rooms.description: This dank, cramped cell appears dwarf-sized, just small enough to be very uncomfortable for a regular-size human.  The stone walls create a steadfast holding place.  A barred door, also made of stone, is the only exit east.

East.description: A barred stone door blocks the way.

rooms.name: Inside the Fireplace
rooms.description: This rather large fireplace is big enough for a bonfire of massive proportions.  A fire roars in the center, sending plumes of charcoal- covered smoke skywards.  Stone steps, barely visible through the smoke, allow access to the chimney above.  The laboratory is accessible to the east.

rooms.name: Up the Chimney
rooms.description: Swirling black smoke makes visibility nearly zero here.  Narrow stone steps, cut into the pitted granite walls, lead upwards and downwards. Soot blankets everything, making progress in any direction a very dirty process.  A boiling heat flares into this passage from below.  The chimney continues upwards, or leads down into the fire.

rooms.name: Up the Chimney
rooms.description: Black smoke swirls about, making the air thick and nearly unbreathable. Narrow stone steps, cut into the granite walls, lead downwards.  A small hole allows exit of the smoke; perhaps also allowing exit for a dwarf or gnome.  A wrenching heat boils into the room from below.  The chimney continues downwards.

rooms.name: The Viper Pit
rooms.description: The walls down this hole are completely covered in slime: thick, green layers of it, all squishy and wet.  The floor is filled with it, nearly two feet deep in places.  Movement under the slime causes it to wiggle, caused by whatever lives under slime.  The north wall has a set of slippery, treacherous steps, that appear to be the only way out.
